tit.cmt: 記事のヒントになるよう（）に補足を入れました。

sen.j: 郡制（ぐんせい）とは、明治期から大正期にかけて府県と町村との間に位置する郡を地方自治体として定めた日本国内における法律である。
sen.e: Gunsei was a domestic law of Japan during the period of Meiji and Taisho era, which stipulated Gun, a district occupying an intermediate position between a prefecture and a municipality, as a local government.

sen.j: 江戸時代までの郡は明治初年の大区小区制のもとでは無視され、住民の反発が大きかった。
sen.e: Gun, which had existed before Edo period, was ignored in daiku-shoku system (a centralized district system that abolished all pre-existing towns, villages and their offices and institutions) introduced in 1878, which aroused fierce opposition among the residents.

sen.e: Gun, which had existed before Edo period, was ignored in daiku-shoku system (a centralized district system that abolished all pre-existing towns, villages and their offices and institutions) introduced at the beginning of Meiji period, which aroused fierce opposition among the residents.

sen.j: このことから、1878年（明治11年）郡区町村編制法を制定し、旧来の郡を行政単位として認め、郡役所と郡長（官選）が置かれた。
sen.e: Therefore, Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), which authorized the existing Gun as an administrative unit and placed Gunyakusho (a district office) and Guncho (a district headman chosen by the government), was established in 1878.

sen.j: 郡には議決機関として郡会と郡参事会が設けられた。
sen.e: In each Gun, Gunkai (a district association) and Gunsanjikai (a district council) were set up as decision-making bodies.

sen.j: 郡会議員は3分の2が各町村議会の互選であった。
sen.e: Two-thirds of the Gunkai members were chosen by an internal vote of town and village assemblies.

sen.j: 残りの3分の1が所有している土地の地価が1万円以上の大地主の互選とされた。
sen.e: The other one-thirds were chosen by an internal vote among large landowners owning land valued in more than ten thousand yen.

sen.j: 郡参事会は郡長と府県知事が任命する郡参事会員（名誉職）により構成された。
sen.e: The Gunsanjikai consisted of council members (regarded as honorary position) who were appointed by Guncho and the prefectural governor.

sen.j: 郡には課税権がなかった。
sen.e: Gun did not have the right to levy taxes.

sen.j: また内務大臣・府県知事の監督下にあった。
sen.e: In addition, it was under the control of Minister of Home Affairs and prefectural governors.

sen.j: よって郡長は国・府県の出先機関として町村の戸長を通じて中央の行政命令を下達する機関に過ぎなかった。
sen.e: Therefore, the function of Guncho was nothing but a regional office of the national or prefectural government, sending down an administrative order from the central government through the Kocho (register chiefs) of towns and villages.

sen.j: 郡の分置廃合への反対が強かったため、全府県に郡制が施行されたのは1899年（明治32年）に郡制が改正されてからである。
sen.e: As there had been a strong opposition against separation, installation, abolition and amalgamation of Gun, it was not until 1899 when Gunsei was revised that Gunsei became effective in all the prefectures.

sen.j: 日露戦争の後頃から郡制廃止の問題が起こった。
sen.e: Around the time after Russo-Japanese War, controversy erupted over abolition of Gunsei.

sen.j: 1921年（大正10年）原敬内閣は郡制廃止を実施した。
sen.e: In 1921, the cabinet of Prime Minister Takashi HARA abolished Gunsei.

sen.j: 郡会は1923年に、郡役所と郡長は1926年に廃止となった。
sen.e: Following this, Gunkai was abolished in 1923, and Gunyakusho and Guncho were abolished in 1926.

sen.j: 以後郡は単なる地理的名称として残ることとなった．
sen.e: Ever since then, however, Gun has remained merely as geographical term.
